article_title: Crisis in Ukraine: German Firms Lose Sway Over Relations With Moscow
article_text:
As the Ukraine crisis intensifies, German business leaders find themselves in an odd place: the back seat.

For decades, German businesses and politicians worked hand-in-hand to improve ties with Russia. Companies that sold everything from shoes, to cars, to industrial machinery wanted access to the giant market to the east. As a result, Germany became Russia's most important Western business partner.

But those common political...

twitter.description: German businesses and politicians for decades worked hand-in-hand to improve ties with Russia. But those common interests appear to be waning as Merkel threatens trade sanctions over Ukraine.
twitter.creator: @AntonWSJ

image.alt: German firms are finding themselves iced out as Merkel threatens sanctions against Russia
